page.title: 19YOXALL_HISTORY & BUILDINGS
page.content: The Cottage Hospital on Town Hill was financed by Louisa Meynell of Hoar Cross, and built in 1873 on land provided by the Arden family.Florence Nightingale advised on its design.The area has many Georgian properties and also timber framed buildings,some with Georgian frontages added. Birmingham House on the corner of King St.and Victoria St.has an early 17th C timber frame.It was the home of George Walton father of Izaak,and is now an antique shop.Thimble Hall on School Green is a very early building.Nine Boys School on School Green was founded at Hadley End in 1695 by Thomas Taylor who left his property in Yoxall to provide an income of 10 shillings for the master to teach 5 poor boys.His widow Sarah left further endowment for 9 boys who moved to new premises at School Green. St.Peter's School,1896 is still used.
